intro: Epilobium fragile, commonly known as slender willow herb, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in wet meadows, riverbanks, and woodland edges. Epilobium fragile is a member of the Onagraceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
